title: FPV Drone Frame
description: Schema for an FPV drone frame, including geometry, material, mounting compatibility, and prop clearance specifications.

id.description: Unique identifier for the frame, typically a UUID or slug.

manufacturer.description: Name of the frame manufacturer (e.g., ImpulseRC, TBS, iFlight).

model.description: Model name of the frame (e.g., Apex HD, Source One V5).

prop_size_inches.description: Nominal propeller size this frame is designed for, in inches (e.g., 5, 3.5, 7).

arm_thickness_mm.description: Thickness of each arm in millimeters. Thicker arms increase durability but add weight.

material.description: Primary material of the frame. Carbon fiber is standard for racing and freestyle; TPU is used for ducted micro frames.

topology.description: Arm layout geometry. 'true_x' has equal arm angles; 'stretch_x' pushes front motors forward for less prop wash in forward flight; 'deadcat' angles rear arms inward to keep props out of camera view; 'h_frame' uses parallel arm plates.

stack_mounting_mm.description: Mounting hole pattern for the FC/ESC stack. Must match the FC and ESC mounting patterns.

motor_mounting_mm.description: Motor mounting hole pattern at each arm tip. Must match the motor mounting pattern (e.g., 16x16, 19x19).

weight_g.description: Dry weight of the frame kit in grams, including all carbon parts and supplied hardware.

max_prop_inches.description: Maximum propeller diameter in inches that the frame can physically accommodate without arm-to-prop interference.

price_usd.description: Price in US dollars for the complete frame kit.
